ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned lots of grammar and vocab and gained an appreciation for Hebrew language and culture.
I learned how to speak, read, write, and type in Hebrew. I also gained knowledge of Israeli culture and modern style conversation skills.
I learned how to read, write, speak, and listen to Hebrew more proficiently. I also learned a great deal about Israeli culture.
I learned hebrew! What an amazing course! Would highly recommend!
I learned the past tense, new verbs and vocabulary which allowed me to construct more complex sentences in Hebrew.
Past tense, other grammar topics, lots of new vocab, listening skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a wonderful course! Overall well-designed and thorough. The student is truly able to learn the language.
This course does a good job of having students interact with each other so that they can learn about each other. It could do a better job of teaching kids simpler classroom objects as words.
The professors in the hebrew dept are wonderful and this course was well designed for my learning! I loved this course

The strengths include engaging students fully in Hebrew learning, looking at the language from the side of Judaism, Israel and how the language itself was developed. I really love Hebrew as a language now. Another strength is the feedback and the varied assignments that we were given. A weakness is that even though we meet every day it's hard to retain new vocabulary and I still don't feel very confident speaking.

Strengths: are good teaching / high engagement. Weaknesses: Would have been better with fewer nightly homeworks and no final project (which didn't teach me much) but harder weekly quizzes. That would have helped me learn the vocab better.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! A great language and a great class.

I would recommend this class to anyone who is interested in learning the Hebrew language, either for personal benefit or for practical use. You will truly learn how to speak, read, and write in Hebrew!
Absolutely. I think it is fun and easy to learn Hebrew and the department does a fantastic job of making you fall in love with it. Plus, the instructors are phenomenal.
I would recommend Hebrew to anyone looking for a language credit

I would. I don't even think you really have to have an intense interest in Hebrew or Israel. It's a very fun course and an interesting language to learn. I would watch out for the workload, because there is consistent homework every night - but the voice recordings and journal entries makes it more thoughtful than just busy work.
